$AVGO My calls will print today

@justAtool Anything quality, preferably with lower P/Es unless the growth story is bonafide. I like $AVGO. I've got LEAPs on $NET because cyber security should be a bigger part of tech moving forward (that and I use cloudflare so I know it's good). $CRWD reports tomorrow so I'll be watching that action, should be a good indicator on this space overall. 
 
$NVDA is now trading sideways instead of down, assuming we get a bounce tomorrow (see chart). $AMD has the same chart as $NVDA. If it breaks that bottom support though all bets are off. So I'm waiting and being patient. 
 
Some of this might still be a bit early. I'm not convinced the selling pressure is exhausted yet but I think we're getting close. When energy/commodities roll over and growth starts moving up you'll know the rotation is happening. Not likely until after FOMC. 
 
The other outcome is maybe Wallstreet and the fed have changed their ways, money will tighten and thus value stocks will lead the market. But I doubt it.

👉 $VRTX : VRTX stock popped 3.6% to 238.66 last week, rebounding from its 50-day and 10-week lines for the first time in its recent runs. Friday's move came on above-average volume, so it's actionable. Also Vertex now has a flat base with a buy point of 255.03, according to a weekly MarketSmith chart. The RS line for VRTX stock is at a 52-week high.

👉 $AVGO : AVGO stock rose 1.4% to 595.99 last week. Shares popped 3% on Friday, but it was unable to close above the 50-day line. Investors could use 614.74, just above the Feb. 10 high, as an early entry. The official buy point is still far away at 677.86. But the RS line is already close to highs.

👉 Dow Jones futures fell sharply Sunday night, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures, while crude oil futures skyrocketed as pressure grew for a Russian oil embargo The stock market rally attempt saw losses last week, reversing from key resistance as Russia's Ukraine invasion continued to roil financial markets. $SPY $DJIA

👉 $AVGO stock and the others listed here are all trading near their 50-day lines, close to possible early entries while working on proper bases. Broadcom and $COST stock moved Friday after earnings Thursday night. The relative strength lines for $REGN stock and the others here are at or near consolidation or long-term highs. That's an especially bullish signal for stocks still in bases.

$AVGO just crossed above its 20-day moving average.
